parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>Command</title><part><name>Comments</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> arma </value></part><part><name>Game name</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.00</value></part><part><name>Game version</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>gr1 </name>=<value> Markers </value></part><part><name>GROUP1</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>eff</name>=<value> global </value></part><part><name>Effects in MP</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Creates a new map marker at the given position. '''The marker will be created for every player on network as well as JIP'''. The marker name has to be unique, if a marker with the given name exists, the command will be ignored. Use [[deleteMarker]] to delete global marker.
<template lineStart="1"><title>Important</title><part><name index="1"/><value>The marker will be visible once at least [[markerType]] has been defined:
<div><code>_markerName <template><title>=</title></template> [[createMarker]] ["markername", [[player]]];
_markerName [[setMarkerType]] "hd_dot";</code></div></value></part></template>
<template lineStart="1"><title>Informative</title><part><name index="1"/><value>If position is given in 3D format, the <tt>z</tt> coordinate is stored with the marker and will be used when marker is passed to commands like [[createVehicle]], [[createUnit]], [[createAgent]], [[createMine]], [[setVehiclePosition]] for example. When marker is manually placed in the editor, <tt>z</tt> is 0, which means it is placed on the ground. However when user manually places marker on the map in game, it is placed on the water, so <tt>z</tt> of the marker will be: <tt>[[-]][[getTerrainHeightASL]] [[markerPos]] &lt;USERMARKER&gt;</tt></value></part></template>
<template lineStart="1"><title>Informative</title><part><name index="1"/><value>'''Multiplayer optimisation:''' Global marker commands always broadcast the ''entire'' marker state over the network. As such, the number of network messages exchanged when creating or editing a marker can be reduced by performing all but the last operation using local marker commands, then using a global marker command for the last change (and subsequent global broadcast of all changes applied to the marker).</value></part></template>
</value></part><part><name>Description</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> [[createMarker]] [name, position, channel, creator] </value></part><part><name>Syntax</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> [name, position, channel, creator]: [[Array]] </value></part><part><name>Parameter 1</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p2</name>=<value> name: [[String]] </value></part><part><name>Parameter 2</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p3</name>=<value> position: [[Array]] or [[Object]] - format position: [[Position2D]], [[PositionAGL]] or [[Object]] (object's [[PositionWorld]] is used)</value></part><part><name>Parameter 3</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p4</name>=<value> channel: [[Number]] - (Optional) The marker channel for MP. <template><title>since</title><part><name index="1"/><value>arma3</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>2.01.146752</value></part></template></value></part><part><name>Parameter 4</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p5</name>=<value> creator: [[Object]] - (Optional) The marker creator for MP. <template><title>since</title><part><name index="1"/><value>arma3</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>2.01.146752</value></part></template></value></part><part><name>Parameter 5</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[String]] </value></part><part><name>Return value</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________
		  
</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>_marker1 = [[createMarker]] ["Marker1", [[position]] [[player]]];</code> </value></part><part><name>Example 1</name>=<value>
</value></part><part><name>x2</name>=<value> <code>_marker2 = [[createMarker]] ["Marker2", [[player]]]; <template><title>codecomment</title><part><name index="1"/><value>// since <template><title>arma3</title></template> v1.50</value></part></template></code> </value></part><part><name>Example 2</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name>mp</name>=<value> [[createMarker]] is global, use [[createMarkerLocal]] if you want to create a [[local]] marker. </value></part><part><name>multiplayer</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="6"/><value> [[allMapMarkers]], [[deleteMarker]], [[createMarkerLocal]]
[[setMarkerBrush]], [[setMarkerColor]], [[setMarkerDir]]
[[setMarkerPos]], [[setMarkerShape]], [[setMarkerSize]]
[[setMarkerText]], [[setMarkerType]], [[setMarkerAlpha]], [[BIS_fnc_markerToString]], [[BIS_fnc_stringToMarker]] </value></part><part><name>See also</name>=<value>
</value></part></template>

<h3 style="display:none">Notes</h3>
<dl class="command_description">
<dd class="notedate">Posted on September 19, 2015 - 21:02 (UTC)</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:Soldia (JP)|Soldia (JP)]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
createMarker accepts an object as position parameter as well (A3 - 1.50.131969). You could try this with the following code (both SP/MP)

<code>_markerstr = [[createMarker]] ["markername", [[player]]];
_markerstr [[setMarkerShape]] "RECTANGLE";
_markerstr [[setMarkerSize]] [100, 100];</code>
</dd>
</dl>
<comment><!-- DISCONTINUE Notes -->
</comment>
<comment><!-- CONTINUE Notes -->
</comment><dl class="command_description">
<dd class="notedate">Posted on May 28, 2018 - 11:57 (UTC)</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:x39|x39]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
In Arma 3, one can create markers which are deletable by the user by prefixing the name with `_USER_DEFINED`.

Example: <code>[[createMarker]] "_USER_DEFINED someMarkerName"</code>
</dd>
</dl>

<comment><!-- CONTINUE Notes -->
</comment><dl class="command_description">
<dd class="notedate">Posted on April 11, 2019 - 07:10 (UTC)</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:killzone_kid|killzone_kid]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
Passing object as argument for position may produce slightly different position than when explicitly obtaining object position via position commands, as in 
<code>[[createMarker]] ["marker1", _obj]</code>
may slightly differ from
<code>[[createMarker]] ["marker1", [[ASLtoAGL]] [[getPosASL]] _obj]</code>
This is because when object passed as position, the raw [[getPosWorld]] is used
<code>[[createMarker]] ["marker1", [[ASLtoAGL]] [[getPosWorld]] _obj]</code> will produce identical result in this case, but may not be what is required
</dd>
</dl>
<comment><!-- DISCONTINUE Notes -->
</comment>
<comment><!-- CONTINUE Notes -->
</comment><dl class="command_description">
<dd class="notedate">Posted on May 3, 2019 - 15:53 (UTC)</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:7erra|7erra]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
<template lineStart="1"><title>GVI</title><part><name index="1"/><value>arma3</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.92</value></part></template> There is a new function with which you can create a marker with all settings applied in one step: [[BIS_fnc_stringToMarker]] and [[BIS_fnc_stringToMarkerLocal]]
</dd>
</dl>
<comment><!-- DISCONTINUE Notes --></comment></root>
